CactusTool.Carpet package¶

Submodules¶

CactusTool.Carpet.ASCII module¶

Cactus dataset main produced by Carpet, which is an adaptive mesh refinement and multi-patch driver for the Cactus. This modular processes output of CarpetIOASCII.

class CactusTool.Carpet.ASCII.CarpetIOASCII(files)[source]¶

Bases: object

Thorn CarpetIOASCII provides I/O methods for outputting gird function in ASCII format into files. This class can handle all CarpetIOASCII output. Read the dataset from files and return all useful information stored in these files.

CarpetIOASCII itself do nothing. You need specify the dimensions of gird function. This will pointer to Griddim.

  • CarpetIOASCII.x x dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOASCII.y y dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOASCII.z z dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOASCII.xy xy dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOASCII.xz xz dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOASCII.yz yz dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOASCII.xyz xyz dimension of the gird function

Parameters

files (list) – A list of file in absolute path.

class CactusTool.Carpet.ASCII.Griddim(files, dim)[source]¶

Bases: object

For gird function, We need choose the dimension of the gird function. Then choose the variable we want to processes, this will pointer to Variable.

Parameters

  • files (list) – A list of file in absolute path.

  • dim (str) – dimension

property vars¶

All available variable in such dim.

Returns

A dict. key is the variable name, value is corresponding files.

class CactusTool.Carpet.ASCII.Variable(varfiles, dim)[source]¶

Bases: object

In most case, the variable data have refined grid hirachies and may store in different files. We need combine them as needed. Sometimes you want to process a vector or a tensor. Variable can also handel it.

Parameters

  • varfiles (list) – A dict about variable and its file, this variable may be a vector or tensor.

  • dim (str) – dimension

  • Variable.Table source data

dataset(key=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

CarpetIOASCII Dataset will store in pandas dataframe. Because the ASCII data structure more like a table. :param kwargs: Unknown keyword arguments are passed to pd.concat().

Returns

DataFrame

grid_hierarchies(time=0.0)[source]¶

Describes the geometry of the refined grid hierarchies, such as component number, ghost zones and refinement level. These all get from Variable.dataset(). Grid hierarchies may change in the evolution.

# So you need specify the time, the default is initial grid hierarchies (\(t = 0\)).

Parameters

time (float) – grid hierarchies at time

preview(**kwargs)[source]¶

Variable.preview() just simple preview. We will use pandas.DataFrame.plot() to do it. It is best to run Variable.dataset() and check the dataset by eye before executing it.

Parameters

kwargs – Unknown keyword arguments are passed to pandas.DataFrame.plot().

CactusTool.Carpet.ASCII.columns(file)[source]¶

Fetch CarpetIOASCII header information.

Parameters

file (str) – file in absolute path

Returns

The column in given file.

CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5 module¶

Cactus dataset main produced by Carpet, which is an adaptive mesh refinement and multi-patch driver for the Cactus. This modular processes output of CarpetIOHDF5.

class CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5.CarpetIOHDF5(files)[source]¶

Bases: object

Thorn CarpetIOHDF5 provides I/O methods for outputting gird function in HDF5 format into files. This class can handle all CarpetIOHDF5 output. Read the dataset from files and return all useful information stored in these files. We recommend use CarpetIOHDF5 to output all 2-D and 3-D grid function.

CarpetIOHDF5 itself do nothing. You need specify the dimensions of gird function. This will pointer to Griddim.

  • CarpetIOHDF5.x x dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOHDF5.y y dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOHDF5.z z dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOHDF5.xy xy dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOHDF5.xz xz dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOHDF5.yz yz dimension of the gird function

  • CarpetIOHDF5.xyz xyz dimension of the gird function

Parameters

files (list) – A list of file in absolute path.

class CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5.Griddim(files, dim)[source]¶

Bases: object

For gird function, We need choose the dimension of the gird function. Then choose the variable we want to processes, this will pointer to Variable.

Parameters

  • files (list) – A list of file in absolute path.

  • dim (str) – dimension

property vars¶

All available variable in such dim.

Returns

A dict. key is the variable name, value is corresponding files.

class CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5.Variable(varfiles, dim)[source]¶

Bases: object

In most case, the variable data have refined grid hirachies and may store in different files. We need combine them as needed. Sometimes you want to process a vector or a tensor. Variable can also handel it.

Parameters

  • varfiles (list) – A dict about variable and its file, this variable may be a vector or tensor.

  • dim (str) – dimension

  • Variable.Table source data

grid_hierarchies()[source]¶

Describes the geometry of the refined grid hierarchies, such as component number, ghost zones and refinement level. Grid hierarchies may change in the evolution. These all get from the header of files.

Returns

a dict about grid_hierarchies

read(meshgrid='HYDROBASE::press it=0 tl=0 rl=0 c=10')[source]¶

CarpetIOHDF5 is different with CarpetIOASCII. We don’t need read all data in the beginning. 2-D or 3-D data is huge, reading all data at one time is a waste of resources.

Returns

DataFrame

CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5.hdf5_2d(X, Y, data, title=None, colormap='RdBu')[source]¶

Create a pseudocolor plot

Note

The dimensions of X and Y should be one greater than those of C. Alternatively, X, Y and C may have equal dimensions, in which case the last row and column of C will be ignored.

Parameters

  • X (array) – A 1-D array. They will be expanded as needed into the appropriate 2-D arrays, making a rectangular grid.

  • Y (array) – A 1-D array. They will be expanded as needed into the appropriate 2-D arrays, making a rectangular grid.

  • data (array) – A scalar 2-D array. The values will be color-mapped.

  • title (str) – Set figure title.

  • colormap (str) – A Colormap name. The colormap maps the C values to colors.

CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5.iteration(file)[source]¶
CactusTool.Carpet.HDF5.merge_filedata(filelist)[source]¶

CactusTool.Carpet.Scalar module¶

Cactus dataset main produced by Carpet, which is an adaptive mesh refinement and multi-patch driver for the Cactus. This modular processes output of CarpetIOScalar.

class CactusTool.Carpet.Scalar.CarpetIOScalar(files)[source]¶

Bases: object

Thorn CarpetIOScalar provides I/O methods for outputting scalar values in ASCII format into files. This class can handle all CarpetIOScalar output. Read the dataset from files and return all executable reduction operation.

CarpetIOScalar itself do nothing. You need specify the reduction operation. This will pointer to ScalarReduction.

  • CarpetIOScalar.min The minimum of the gird function

  • CarpetIOScalar.max The maximum of the gird function

  • CarpetIOScalar.norm1 The norm1 of the gird function

  • CarpetIOScalar.norm2 The norm2 of the gird function

  • CarpetIOScalar.average The average of the gird function

  • CarpetIOScalar.none The variable is scalar, don’t need do any reduction

Parameters

files (list) – A list of file in absolute path.

>>> ds = CarpetIOScalar(Scalar_file)
>>> print(ds)
Available min timeseries:
[]
Available max timeseries:
['H']
class CactusTool.Carpet.Scalar.ScalarReduction(files, kind)[source]¶

Bases: object

For gird function, We need choose which type of reduction operations. Then choose the variable we want to processes, this will pointer to Variable.

Parameters

  • files (list) – A list of file in absolute path.

  • kind (str) – Type of reduction operations.

property vars¶

All available variable in such reduction.

Returns

A dict. key is the variable name, value is corresponding files.

class CactusTool.Carpet.Scalar.Variable(varfiles)[source]¶

Bases: object

For scalar, we don’t need consider grid structure. These data may store in different files, we just simple combine them and remove duplicate data. This will done by pandas DataFrame. Sometimes you want to process a vector or a tensor. Variable can also handel it.

Parameters

varfiles (list) – A dict about variable and its file, this variable may be a vector or tensor.

  • Variable.Table source data

dataset(key=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

CarpetIOScalar Dataset will store in pandas dataframe, because the ASCII data structure more like a table. This dataset will store in Variable.Table.

Parameters

kwargs – Unknown keyword arguments are passed to pd.concat().

Returns

DataFrame

preview(**kwargs)[source]¶

Variable.preview() just simple preview. We will use pandas.DataFrame.plot() to do it. It is best to run Variable.dataset() and check the dataset by eye before executing it.

Parameters

kwargs – Unknown keyword arguments are passed to pandas.DataFrame.plot().

Fetch CarpetIOScalar header information.

Parameters

Returns

The column in given file.
